  • havoc.autoval.e2e_tests.test_validate.test_validate

Source code for havoc.autoval.e2e_tests.test_validate.test_validate

from __future__ import absolute_import
from __future__ import division
from __future__ import print_function
from __future__ import unicode_literals

from havoc.autoval.lib.test_base import TestBase
from havoc.autotest_testfiles.validation_utils.lib.autoval_exceptions import TestError



[docs]class TestValidate(TestBase):


[docs]    def setup(self):
        super(TestValidate, self).setup(config_check=False, inband_config_check=False)



[docs]    def cleanup(self):
        super(TestValidate, self).cleanup(config_check=False, inband_config_check=False)



[docs]    def execute(self):
        self.validate_condition(True, "Performing havoc e2e test")
        self.validate_equal(False, False, "test validate_equal with bools")
        self.validate_equal('t2', u't2', "test validate_equal with str/unicode")
        result = self.validate_no_exception(
            self.with_args, [1, 2, "abc", {"def": "geh"}], "test with args"
        )
        self.validate_equal(result, "test_result", "test result")
        self.validate_no_exception(
            self.do_something, [], "test validate_no_exception"
        )
        self.validate_exception(
            self.raise_something, [], "test validate_exception"
        )
        self.validate_exception(
            self.raise_test_error,
            [],
            "test validate_exception with TestError",
            exception_type=TestError
        )
        self.validate_in(
            "the full",
            "this is the full string",
            "validate that substring is part of full string"
        )
        self.validate_in(
            3,
            [1, 2, 3, 4],
            "validate that item is in list"
        )
        self.validate_less(3.3, 3.4, "Validate that 3.3 < 3.4")
        self.validate_less_equal(3, 3, "Validate that 3 <= 3")
        self.validate_greater(4, 3, "Validate that 4 > 3")
        self.validate_greater_equal(4, 4, "Validate that 4 >= 4")
        self.validate_empty_list([], "Validate empty list")
        self.validate_empty_diff({}, "Validate empty diff")



[docs]    def do_something(self):
        self.log_info("Everything is fine")



[docs]    def raise_something(self):
        raise Exception("This is an error")



[docs]    def raise_test_error(self):
        raise TestError("This is a test error")



[docs]    def with_args(self, v1, v2, s1, h1):
        self.validate_equal(v1, 1, "argument v1")
        self.validate_equal(v2, 2, "argument v2")
        self.validate_equal(s1, "abc", "argument s1")
        self.validate_equal(h1, {"def": "geh"}, "argument h1")
        return "test_result"




[docs]def main():
    test = TestValidate()
    test.lifecycle()



if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()
